comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: Picture of 2010: It is on the Place Bossuet in Dijon. See Google Streetview. Petitjean in the half-timbered house is still there.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Michiel2005: Thanks for posting the recent photo and the link, helping us locate the photo! :) Petitjean is a bakery I guess? The grocery to the right seems to be replaced by a clothing shop.
/Anna B.

comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: It is Mulot & Petitjean, a company founded in 1796. Since 1805 they are located here on number 13, Place Bossuet. The house dates from the 15th century. It is called l'Hôtel Catin de Richemont, named after an important family who's members served in the parliament of Burgundy. They make & sell Dijonese spice bread and cookies as far as I can gather from their website (you can even order it online): www.mulotpetitjean.fr/ The website has information about the history and some old pictures. See also wikipedia: fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mulot_%26_Petitjean

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Michiel2005: Thanks again for more information! (And that spicy bread looks really delicious, would have loved to have some at my coffe break...)
/Anna B.
